channel.title: YouTube Reliability
channel.description:
Has anyone else's YouTube been messing up lately? Sometimes my video will restart or stop working completely and I will have to refresh the page. It can become quite tedious after a while.
My flash is up-to-date, and when I researched it, it had been an issue for some people back in 2008. All I keep reading is the same generic answer, "clear your cache", "refresh the page". I shouldn't have to do that for every video.
Any one else experienced this problem? Any idea on what the issue is?

item.title: YouTube Reliability
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

For me, the orange bar at the top stating I have videos on Google Video has been there, despite me closing it a hundred times with no avail. Also videos have been taking longer to start playing recently, but other than that it’s been fine.

Read full topic

item.title: YouTube Reliability
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

If I pause a video I have to refresh the page to play it again.

Read full topic

item.title: YouTube Reliability
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Yesterday I was watching a video paused it and it said it was paused but kept playing and when I unpaused it there was 2 audio tracks going at once.

Read full topic

item.title: YouTube Reliability
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

After an updated version of flash, what else is there for us to do? I also get the green screen.

Read full topic

item.title: YouTube Reliability
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Sometimes the audio will stop playing and sometimes I get a green screen. Both just require me to refresh the page, and are probably both errors on my side.

Read full topic

item.title: YouTube Reliability
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

That was quick.

It has worked fine for me in the past, but over the past couple of months it has been playing up. It is tempermental at times too, one day YouTube is unusable for me, and other days (today) it is fine, except for one “An error has occurred, please try again later” message.

Read full topic

item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Works fine for me.

My flash is up-to-date, and when I researched it, it had been an issue for some people back in 2008. All I keep reading is the same generic answer, “clear your cache”, “refresh the page”. I shouldn’t have to do that for every video.
